name: validate that the information is correctly returned, when the latitude and longitude are valid

testSteps.description: Example: {lng=20, mcountryCode=AQ, gmtOffset=6, rawOffset=6, timezoneId=Antarctica/Vostok, dstOffset=6, countryName=Antarctica, time=not null, lat=-90, username=qa_mobile_easy}

children.description:
Given the time zone service is consumed with the data
| -90 | 20 | qa_mobile_easy |
Analyst consume serivice get time zone
analyst executes a GET on the resource /timezoneJSON?formatted=true&lat=-90&lng=20&username=qa_mobile_easy

restQuery.responseHeaders:
Date: Fri, 10 Sep 2021 23:41:36 GMT
Server: Apache/2.4.6 (CentOS) mod_jk/1.2.46 OpenSSL/1.0.2k-fips
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
X-Frame-Options: sameorigin
Cache-Control: no-cache
Keep-Alive: timeout=5, max=100
Connection: Keep-Alive
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8

children.description:
Then the service will respond to the data
| 20 | AQ | 6 | 6 | Antarctica/Vostok | 6 | Antarctica | not null | -90 |
Then check json response has correct service information
